ygData.subject: Heritrix 2.0.0 now available
ygData.msgSnippet: The official Heritrix 2.0.0 release is now available. Release notes, with instructions to download and install, are at:

Subject: Heritrix 2.0.0 now available
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=T3A2Ti52wNu_I8FAAqnE8YZDiK5wlzdYMKBYcPuW28iT

The official Heritrix 2.0.0 release is now available.

Release notes, with instructions to download and install, are at:

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/2.0.0+Release+Notes

The download is available from our Sourceforge files area:

http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=73833&package_id=254931

Four notable differences in Heritrix 2 are:

(1) A more rigorous separation of the Web UI from the 'crawl engine',
giving greater flexibility to control crawlers remotely.
(2) A new settings system, easing module development and offering new
opportunities for dynamic configuration construction.
(3) A new mechanism for custom override settings for sets of related
URIs, extending beyond Heritrix 1.x's domain-centric overrides.
(4) A new system for ordering URIs within a single URI-queue, and for
allocating frontier effort among different URI-queues, based on assigned
integer 'precedence' values.

A tutorial of starting a basic crawl in the changed web UI is
available at:

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/2.0+Tutorial

Documentation for 2.0 is still limited but will gradually improve on the 
project wiki. (There are now direct help links from individual web UI 
settings to actual or potential wiki pages.)

Questions and discussion are as always welcome on the project discussion
list:

archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/

Bugs and enhancement requests may be entered in the JIRA project issue
tracker:

http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER

- Gordon @ IA
